help.name: mris_apply_reg

required-flagged.explanation: Input file that supplies the source values to convert
apply an LTA registration to a surface
apply just the rotational components of an LTA registration to a surface
apply a GCA morph registration to a surface (was --m3z)

optional-flagged.explanation: Map vertex from source to target (stand-alone)

help.example: Map the lh thickness into the symmetric space mris_apply_reg --src lh.thickness --trg xhemi.lh.thickness \ --streg $SUBJECTS_DIR/$subject/surf/lh.fsaverage_sym.sphere.reg \ $SUBJECTS_DIR/fsaverage_sym/surf/lh.sphere.reg

Map the rh thickness into the symmetric space mris_apply_reg --src rh.thickness --trg xhemi.rh.thickness \ --streg $SUBJECTS_DIR/$subject/xhemi/surf/lh.fsaverage_sym.sphere.reg \ $SUBJECTS_DIR/fsaverage_sym/surf/lh.sphere.reg
Note that lh.fsaverage_sym.sphere.reg is used. This is intentional; the left hemis in the xhemi folder are actually right hemis.
Map a label from the left hemi to the right hemi mris_apply_reg --src-label lh.source.label \ --streg lh.sphere.left_right rh.sphere.left_right \ --trg rh.lh.source.label
Map a surface from the anatomical space to fMRI space. First, you have to get an LTA registration file (eg, with bbregister) mris_apply_reg --lta lh.white fmri.reg.lta ./lh.white.fmri
